solution_line_template: On the weekend, Jeff works {weekend_catching_up_hours} / {weekend_work_ratio} = <<{weekend_catching_up_hours}/{weekend_work_ratio}={weekend_work_hours_per_day}>>{weekend_work_hours_per_day} hour each day.

On the weekdays, he spends {weekday_work_ratio} * {weekday_catching_up_hours} = <<{weekday_work_ratio}*{weekday_catching_up_hours}={weekday_work_hours_per_day}>>{weekday_work_hours_per_day} hours working each day.

Thus, he spends {weekend_days} * {weekend_work_hours_per_day} + {weekday_days} * {weekday_work_hours_per_day} = <<{weekend_days}*{weekend_work_hours_per_day}+{weekday_days}*{weekday_work_hours_per_day}={total_work_hours}>>{total_work_hours} hours working each week.
